name: v3.6.1
body: https://github.com/cruise-automation/k-rail/pull/128 implements support for all ingress types for the `ingress_require_ingress_exemption` policy

name: k-rail-v3.6.1
body: Kubernetes security tool for policy enforcement

name: v3.6.0
body: https://github.com/cruise-automation/k-rail/pull/126 adds a policy to disallow usages of all NGINX snippet annotations, in response to [NGINX Ingress Controller vulnerability CVE-2021-25742](https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx/issues/7837).  The new policy is enabled and setup in `report_only` mode to allow operators to override based on individual organizational software development lifecycles.

name: v2.6.0
body:
- **bugfix** - Helm-generated certs now include SAN which should make the chart compatible with newer k8s versions in #97 (Thanks @ossie-git)
- **feature** - Added Deny Unconfined AppArmor policy to prevent some container escape routes in #95

name: v2.1.0
body: **bugfix** - fixed a bug where a `ShareProcessNamespace` policy violation occurs if the value is explicitly false instead of unset in #82 (thanks @js-timbirkett)

name: v2.0.1
body: - **bugfix** - Revert service port to 443 to fix webhook calling failures on some clusters in #76 (Thanks @funkypenguin!)

name: k-rail-v2.0.1
body: Kubernetes security tool for policy enforcement

name: v2.0.0
body:
- **breaking change** - The helm chart configures k-rail to ignore namespaces with the label `k-rail/ignore` present rather than `name=k-rail` by default. Ensure you update your namespace labeling if you use the helm chart.
- **feature** - Added `No Anonymous Cluster Role Binding` and `No Anonymous Role Binding` policies in #75 (thanks @shellw!)
- **bugfix** - Fixed the core group specified in the Service resource extractor and added `services` to the MutatingWebhookConfiguration to fix the `Service type LoadBalancer annotation check` policy
- **feature** - The automated helm chart releases are now working. See the installation section of the readme if you wish to adopt that deployment method.

name: k-rail-v2.0.0
body: Kubernetes security tool for policy enforcement

name: k-rail-v1.5.1
body: Kubernetes security tool for policy enforcement

name: v1.5.1
body:
- Fix bug in helm chart where service name and namespace name were transposed (#71) - thanks @andyspiers!
- Automatic chart releases and repo (#72) - thanks @funkypenguin!

name: v1.5.0
body:
- Added Service type LoadBalancer annotation check policy. This will ensure that that only LoadBalancer Services with the specified annotations are allowed unless there is an exemption. Useful for preventing accidental public loadbalancers. Thanks @bvandewalle! #65 
- Added No Persistent Volume Host Path policy to prevent HostPath PersistentVolumes. These volumes enable r/w access to the node filesystem. Thanks @shellw! #68

name: v1.4.1
body: - Unique Ingress Host policy now allows >1 ingress in the same namespace to specify the same host and prints what namespaces are in violation (#66 - thanks @shellw)

name: v1.4.0
body: - Added Unique Ingress Host policy (#63 - thanks @shellw!), which prevents more than one ingress from declaring the same host.

name: v1.3.2
body:
- fixes server error during pod execs and add additional tests (#60 thanks @curx, #61)
- add documentation on failure policies and added revocation policy (#58 thanks @jleadford)
- fix build-time tests (#53)

name: v1.3.1
body: - Update deployment when mTLS secrets change (Thanks @Montycarlo)

name: v1.3.0
body:
- Cache decoded resources #38 Thanks @alpe.
- Add EmptyDirSizeLimit policy in #40, which enables you to set a max size for ephemeral volumes, and a default if none is provided. Thanks @alpe.
- Add EnforceImagePullPolicy policy in #44, which enables you to override the ImagePullPolicy for configured images. Thanks @lanluo.

name: v1.2.0
body: - **feature** - Added No ShareProcessNamespace policy in #35 . Thanks @jleadford.

name: v1.1.1
body: **bugfix** - Fixed an embarrassing log level parsing issue that prevented startup for v1.1 in #33. Thanks @funkypenguin

name: v1.1
body:
- **feature** - Mutate default seccomp profile policy added in #22. When enabled, it'll run Pods with the `runtime/default` seccomp policy unless otherwise configured or specified by a Pod.
- **contrib** - Added a small script for analyzing some of the v1.0 initContainer breaking changes for existing installs in #27
- **benchmarking** - Added benchmarks for the handler, policies, and exemptions in #28

name: v1.0
body:
- **feature**: No exec policy added in #14. When enabled, this policy prevents execing into a Pod (`kubectl exec`) unless an exemption is present :tada: 
- **breaking change/bugfix**: #21 introduced validating initContainers in policies that iterate through containers. This means that policies you've already had set for prior releases were skipping initContainers, and upgrading to this release may result in new violations if you are using them.
- **breaking change/bugfix**: Improved resource name extraction in #24. This fixes a bug where Pods created by DaemonSets have an empty resource name (#23 thanks @funkypenguin ). It prioritizes using the controlling resource's name (the one you are likely working with), followed by the (possibly generated) resource name, and then the name label. This change should result in more accurate resource names in most cases, but is possible to be a breaking change for your current exemptions.
- **bugfix**: Fixed `PodSecurityPolicy` compatibility when using `RunAsNonRoot` by switching from named user to numeric user in #19. Thanks @funkypenguin.
- **deprecation**: The [`Safe to Evict`](https://github.com/cruise-automation/k-rail#safe-to-evict) policy has been deprecated in favor of the [`Mutate Safe to Evict`](https://github.com/cruise-automation/k-rail#mutate-safe-to-evict) policy and is now disabled by default in the deployment.

name: v0.2
body:
bugfix: Fixed detection of `networking.k8s.io/v1beta1` `ingresses`
feature: Make `failurePolicy` of the webhook configurable (defaults to Fail)
feature: Enable server dry-run of resources
feature: Adds support for mutating policies
feature: Adds `pod_mutate_safe_to_evict` policy to facilitate the cluster autoscaler

name: v0.1.1
body:
bugfix: Helm template now creates the namespace and namespaces the mTLS secret
bugfix: `ValidationWebhookConfiguration` now includes `ingresses` to enable the Ingress policies.

name: v0.1
body: Initial release of k-rail :tada:
